meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive George Seymour Claudia Grimes Brad Plovan Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #2597.

div.div:
Brad Plovan game 2.
Missing second half of J! round.
Episode begins with presentation about Jeopardy!'s USO tours.

td.p: George Seymour, an Army officer from Tokyo, Japan
Claudia Grimes, a pharmacy technician and substitute teacher from Akron, Ohio
Brad Plovan, a lawyer from Baltimore, Maryland (whose 1-day cash winnings total $7,200)

tr.td: 19th CENTURY AMERICANS
SPORTS
GEOGRAPHY
SWEETS
MEN NAMED JOSEPH
COTTON

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_2_2', 'clue_DJ_2_2_stuck', '(Claudia: [Thinks for a bit, then responds] What are Thoroughbreds?)
(Alex: Oooh. Darn. You made the mistake I was hoping you would not make. [*] is a 12-letter word. [*]s is a 13-letter word, and so it will cost you. I\'m sorry about that. Please select again.)

Thoroughbred

Claudia
')

tr.td: Brad
Claudia

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: A distinguished career in World War I, but not so in World War II.)
...
(Alex: [To Claudia] No, Vichy was the name of a place, the Vichy government, of course.)
...
(Alex: [To George] Maréchal Pétain. Yes.)
ClaudiaWho was Vichy?
$200
GeorgeWho was Petain
$5,999
BradWho was Petain
$3,601
Philippe Pétain')

tr.td: HISTORIC QUOTES
In 1945 this Frenchman told his countrymen, "If I treated with the enemy, it was to spare you"
Brad
Claudia
George
